 Attachment]

Hi Lauren,

thanks for your help, I was just using the default set of rules=
.  I=E2=80=99m trying the rules you suggested and it seems to be a much bet=
ter scope.

Best regards,

Nigel

> On 28 Oct 2016, at 13:00, 'Ko, Lauren' =
lauren.ko@... [archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote=
:
> 
> [Attachment(s) <x-msg://9/#TopText> from Ko, Lauren included below]
=
> 
> 
> Hi Nigel,
> It is hard to say specifically what your issue might be=
 without knowing your seed and how your scope decide rules are set. However=
, you should be able to configure Heritrix to do what you want using some o=
f the scope rules described here:
> 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/dis=
play/Heritrix/Configuring+Crawl+Scope+Using+DecideRules <https://webarchive=
.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Configuring+Crawl+Scope+Using+DecideRules>
=
> 
> You could use a SurtPrefixedDecideRule to rule in URLs fitting http://=
www.example.com/foo/baa/* <http://www.example.com/foo/baa/*>.
> 
> If the i=
mages you are trying to get are embedded on the http://www.example.com/foo/=
baa/* <http://www.example.com/foo/baa/*> pages, you should be able to get t=
hose using a TransclusionDecideRule.
> 
> I am attaching a sample of what t=
he decide rules could look like.
> 
> Thanks,
> Lauren Ko
> UNT Libraries
>=
 
> 
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:archive-crawler@yahoog=
roups.com> <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogr=
oups.com>> on behalf of Nigel Daniels nigel.daniels@... <mailto:nigel.da=
niels@...> [archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:ar=
chive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>>
> Sent: Thursday, October 27, 2016 10:10:41=
 PM
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com <mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogrou=
ps.com>
> Subject: [archive-crawler] How do I restrict Heritrix 3.2.0 archi=
ving?
>  
>  
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I=E2=80=99m new to using Heritrix and I=E2=80=
=99m trying to configure a job that will only pull pages from a URI with a =
path and a separate domain (where some images are from).  For example I jus=
t want to get pages from:
> 
> http://www.example.com/foo/baa/* <http://www=
.example.com/foo/baa/*> 
> i.e. from this point in the domains path and any=
 links that descend the path tree from that point.
> http://www,examplemedi=
a.com/ <http://www,examplemedia.com/>
> e.g where the images the previous s=
ite uses
> 
> As I understood it Heritrix applies restrictive rules already=
 but it seems to be crawling up the path I am providing as a seed.  However=
 I=E2=80=99m really struggling to make sense of the docs on Heritrix 3.2 on=
 how exactly I do this.
> 
> I appreciate any advice on how to do this.
> 
=
> Best regards,
> 
> Nigel
> 
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_0B4B3ECD-F3C1-49D5-AB73-6C703DE0149E
